description: This trap indicates that a Network Timing Protocol Server is in service.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-NTP-SERVICES-MIB::sonusNtpServerInServiceNotification SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-NTP-SERVICES-MIB::sonusNtpServerName s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 4

description: The shelf index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex

description: The slot index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex

description: The name of this NTP Server Peer.
variables.name: SONUS-NTP-SERVICES-MIB::sonusNtpServerName

description: A description of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription

description: The category of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass

description: The severity level of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel

description: This trap indicates that a Network Timing Protocol Server is out of service.
